summary: This document is an FBI electronic communication requesting the Trenton Resident Agency to conduct an interview with federal inmate Steven Hoffenberg regarding his knowledge of Jeffrey Epstein's involvement in the murder of Arthur L. Shapiro. It details the background of Alfredo Rodriguez, a former butler to Epstein, and his attempts to sell information about additional victims.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Rodriguez was the previous house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein and was involved in an obstruction of justice case for attempting to sell information about additional victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the subject of an investigation for child prostitution and was previously convicted of lesser offenses in Florida.

persons.name: Steven Hoffenberg
persons.context: Hoffenberg is a federal inmate who has information regarding Epstein's potential involvement in a murder case and is being requested for an interview.

persons.name: Bradley Edwards
persons.context: Edwards represented several victims in civil litigation against Epstein and deposed Rodriguez during the discovery process.

persons.name: Arthur L. Shapiro
persons.context: Shapiro was an attorney murdered in 1985, and Hoffenberg has claimed to have information regarding Epstein's involvement in his murder.

persons.name: Michael J. Donohoe
persons.context: Donohoe approved the electronic communication requesting the interview of Hoffenberg.

persons.name: Christina Pryor
persons.context: Pryor drafted the electronic communication and is the contact for the investigation.

connections.description: Rodriguez was employed as Epstein's house manager and butler.
Rodriguez was deposed by Edwards, who represented victims in civil litigation against Epstein.
Hoffenberg was a former business associate of Epstein and has information regarding him.
Hoffenberg has claimed knowledge of Epstein's involvement in the murder of Shapiro.

events.title: Murder of Arthur L. Shapiro
events.description: Arthur L. Shapiro was murdered in Columbus, Ohio, and the case remains unsolved.

events.title: Investigation of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The Miami Division began an investigation into Epstein for child prostitution.

events.title: Obstruction of Justice Case Against Alfredo Rodriguez
events.description: An obstruction of justice case was opened against Rodriguez for attempting to sell information about additional victims.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez was the house manager and butler for Jeffrey Epstein.
Rodriguez attempted to sell information about additional victims for monetary compensation.
Steven Hoffenberg is a federal inmate who claims to have information regarding Epstein's involvement in a murder case.
Arthur L. Shapiro was murdered in 1985, and Hoffenberg has linked Epstein to this case.
Rodriguez was deposed by attorney Bradley Edwards during civil litigation against Epstein.
